12:20.race_name: Join Coral Bet £10 Get £50 Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie De LHerminet
runners.comment: Won first two hurdle races but flopped in Listed race last time and has big penalty here
runners.name: Shabalko dHerm
runners.spotlight: Launched hurdling career with two 2m wins in the autumn (good/soft) but disappointed when upped to Listed level last month and, even if back on song, this is a fairly tough task under his 10lb penalty.

runners.comment: Made very promising hurdle debut in November and did not need to improve to win last time
runners.name: Baron Noir
runners.owner: Noel Fehily Racing Syndicate- Baron Noir
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner, latterly at last spring's Punchestown festival (yielding), and did not need to better the form of his promising hurdle debut to win cosily at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) last month; ought to be a tough nut to crack here.

runners.breeder: A Peltier D Juste & J Houdin
runners.comment: Fontwell winner on hurdle debut; held over 2m4f since but has part to play if back on song
runners.name: Kocktail Bleu
runners.spotlight: Placed in both bumpers last season and made winning hurdle debut in 14-runner Fontwell maiden (2m1f, good to soft) in November; below that form when upped to 2m4f later that month and has a bit to find with the principals here but can play a part if back on song.

runners.comment: Beat fairly useful yardstick when scoring at Wincanton last month; likely contender
runners.name: Swingin Safari
runners.spotlight: Useful in bumpers last season; held every chance before last-flight fall in what has turned out to be a strong Chepstow maiden hurdle (2m, good to soft) in November and beat a fairly useful yardstick when scoring at Wincanton (1m7f, soft) last month; likely contender.

runners.comment: Did not get competitive in first two hurdle races
runners.name: Can U Feel It
runners.spotlight: Did not get competitive in first two hurdle races (ride he was given last time attracted stewards' attention) and needs to take a huge step forward here; hood refitted.

runners.comment: Made very promising start to Flat career in Ireland; now hurdling for top jumps stable
runners.name: Gambino
runners.spotlight: Looked very promising on both Flat starts in Ireland for Noel Meade last year, winning 9.5f maiden before finishing second in 1m4f handicap; set daunting assignment on hurdling debut but has joined a top jumps stable and good market support will bring him into the equation.

runners.comment: Safely held on his first two hurdling starts and fell at first flight on latest outing
runners.name: My Fortune
runners.spotlight: With a good stable but was safely held on his first two hurdling starts (2m/1m7f) and fell at the first flight on latest outing.

runners.comment: Not beaten far when last of five at Cheltenham but others have more compelling form
runners.name: The Egyptian Ginge
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with two promising bumper runs (one here) and wasn't beaten far when last of five in good 4yo hurdle at Cheltenham (2m, good; first time hood) in October; unable to land a blow in Haydock Grade 2 (1m7f, good to soft) in November, though, and others here have more compelling form.

12:55.race_name: Coral "Daily Rewards Shaker" Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Very well suited by this course but needs to get his career back on track
runners.name: Outlaw Peter
runners.owner: The Stewart Family Dench Ferguson & Mason
runners.spotlight: Not at best on either start during very light campaign last season and looked out of sorts when last of three on reappearance outing in November; on a good mark now and very well suited by this course but needs to get his career back on track.

runners.comment: Made good start to his chasing career in the autumn and probably still has potential
runners.name: Go West
runners.spotlight: Won match race on seasonal/chase debut in November and looked set to follow up before being pipped on the post in five-runner Doncaster handicap (2m3f, good to soft) last month; probably still has potential over fences and was a course winner over hurdles; must be considered.

runners.comment: Game front-runner who ran well on both starts this season (hurdle/chase); respected
runners.name: Lookaway
runners.spotlight: Game front-runner who returned from layoff with close third over hurdles in October and gave another good account when third over fences at Newbury (2m, good to soft) last month, where a last-fence error didn't help; not yet fully exposed as a chaser and this move back up in trip won't be a problem; respected.

runners.comment: C&D winner; career-best form when second on seasonal debut at Newbury in November
runners.name: Leader In The Park
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 8yo who gained the first of last season's two chasing wins over C&D (good) and probably posted career-best form when second at Newbury (2m6f, good to soft) on reappearance outing in November; has to take a 4lb rise on the chin but may yet have a bigger run in him.

runners.comment: Won readily at Newbury just after Christmas and remains lightly raced over fences
runners.name: Old Cowboy
runners.spotlight: Built upon satisfactory seasonal/chase debut when winning readily by 4l at Newbury (2m, good) just after Christmas; not sure to be suited by this return to a right-handed track but a recent 5lb rise certainly does not look excessive, and the move back up in trip ought to suit.

runners.comment: Kept on steadily for fourth on last month's seasonal/chase/handicap debut; can improve
runners.name: Peso
runners.spotlight: Very unexposed 6yo who comfortably won a 2m novice hurdle at Newbury (good to soft) last season and kept on steadily for very respectable fourth on seasonal/chase/handicap debut there (2m4f, good to soft) last month; can be dangerous if he can build on that.

13:30.race_name: Coral Racing Club Join For Free Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: French form has substance; ran promisingly at Cheltenham on British debut; respected
runners.name: Precious Man
runners.spotlight: French form has substance and he ran promisingly under a penalty, despite failing to justify favouritism, at Cheltenham on British debut; had wind surgery since; retains potential and commands respect.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten at Kempton in two starts (AW/hurdle) for new yard
runners.name: Chartwell Jock
runners.spotlight: Flat winner for previous yard but soundly beaten at Kempton in two starts (AW/hurdle) for new stable; opposed.

runners.comment: Made all in first-time blinkers at Doncaster; may have more to offer in the headgear
runners.name: Dissident
runners.owner: Ben Haynes And Mrs Samantha Dunn
runners.spotlight: Gamely made all in first-time blinkers at Doncaster, building on his C&D effort and getting off the mark (maiden on Flat); may have more to offer in the retained headgear; in the mix.

runners.comment: Did too much up front at Catterick switched to hurdles; hood applied
runners.name: Frank Stamper
runners.spotlight: Consistent efforts on Flat for previous stable; weakened into modest third at Catterick switched to hurdles, having done too much up front; fitting of hood may help.

runners.comment: Dual Flat winner who looks likely to step up on Sandown hurdles effort
runners.name: King Al
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner who is the type to do well in juvenile hurdles for his yard; not exactly an immediate hit at Sandown switched to this code but is open to improvement with the experience under his belt.

runners.comment: Clear promise with his second-place finishes in sole French start and twice in Britain
runners.name: Pourquoi Pas Papa
runners.spotlight: Has shown clear promise with second-place finishes in sole French start (subsequently sold for 200,000euros) and twice in Britain, latest at Exeter (2m, good to soft) yesterday; withdrawn twice in the last week due to good ground; very consistent thus far.

runners.comment: Placed in French Flat races; sold for 140,000euros since; bred to do well over jumps
runners.name: Senator
runners.spotlight: Placed in a couple of French Flat races, showing promise; subsequently sold for 140,000euros; bred to do well over jumps and looks an interesting recruit; market may offer further guidance.

runners.comment: Registered a clearcut win at Taunton on stable/hurdles debut; one of the main players
runners.name: Wertpol
runners.spotlight: Maiden on Flat in Ireland; looks like he'll make a bigger splash over hurdles, having registered a clearcut success at Taunton on the switch to this sphere; one of the main contenders.

runners.comment: Maiden on Flat for Andrew Balding, regressing in last few starts
runners.name: Wise Counsellor
runners.spotlight: Maiden on Flat for Andrew Balding, regressing in last few starts (ended up in sellers); joined new connections for 6,000gns; best watched.

14:05.race_name: Coral "New" Horse Racing Bet Builder Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Defied current mark in Grade 2 handicap in last attempt at Kempton; major player
runners.name: Soul Icon
runners.spotlight: Had plenty to do when unseating rider three out in the Badger Beers at Wincanton (upped to 3m1f from 2m5f) in sole start this term; defied current mark in Grade 2 handicap (over 2m) in last attempt at Kempton; major player back here, assuming he stays this longer trip.

runners.comment: Useful on his day but has stamina to prove back over 3m
runners.name: Your Darling
runners.spotlight: Seemed to need his sole run this season when back from lengthy layoff and bidding to win a 2m5f contest at Ascot for a third time; useful on his day but has stamina to prove, having failed to get home (albeit on soft ground) over C&D in sole 3m attempt.

runners.comment: Has form figures of 112 over 3m under rules; possibilities back at this distance
runners.name: The Doyen Chief
runners.spotlight: Second-season chaser who was pitched into notable handicaps over 3m2f the last twice, losing his chance at the start at Newbury then seemingly outstayed at Cheltenham; generally progressive otherwise and has form figures of 112 over 3m under rules; possibilities back at this distance.

runners.comment: Lightly raced; scored narrowly at Sandown most recently; may improve further over fences
runners.name: Welcom To Cartries
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo who held on narrowly at Sandown (3m, good to soft; handicap chase debut) most recently, adding to his point/hurdle wins and posting a career-best performance; may be capable of further progress in this sphere and commands respect.

runners.comment: Record suggests a return to front-running tactics may prompt a revival
runners.name: Beachcomber
runners.spotlight: Has a doubt over current form having been pulled up in last two starts, latest in Kempton Christmas event that he'd won 12 months earlier; however, an interesting one for in-running punters, as record suggests a return to front-running tactics may prompt a revival.

runners.comment: Faces a tougher task upped in grade and has never won away from Plumpton
runners.name: Sea Invasion
runners.spotlight: Completed a 3m1f double last spring but ran poorly at Wincanton (2m4f) in the hat-trick attempt on return from layoff; appears to have a tougher assignment from 3lb out of weights upped in grade and is still seeking first win away from Plumpton.

runners.comment: Dual Grade 2 winner, including at Kempton, but has to overcome a 6lb penalty
runners.name: Master Chewy
runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery prior to a heavy defeat (3m; faced stiff task) in the King George here last time; returns to a more suitable trip/level and he is a dual Grade 2 winner, including at Kempton; however, has to overcome a 6lb penalty.

runners.comment: Record at Kempton comprises two wins over hurdles and good second in Grade 2 novice chase
runners.name: Boombawn
runners.spotlight: Soft ground possibly contributed to a below-par effort in similar event at Huntingdon last time; strong record at Kempton comprises two wins over hurdles and a good second (last season) in Grade 2 novice chase; interesting back here.

runners.breeder: S A R L Haras Du Berlais
runners.comment: Disappointing in sole run this term but may still have more to offer; remains of interest
runners.name: Kalif Du Berlais
runners.spotlight: Disappointing in the Haldon Gold Cup in sole run this term but largely progressive otherwise, predominantly at about 2m, and may still have more to offer; ended last season with Grade 1 novice chase win at Aintree; pedigree suggests this return to 2m4f is well worth exploring; remains of major interest.

runners.comment: Formerly smart at about 2m; ran encouragingly returned to 2m4f last time; possibilities
runners.name: Edwardstone
runners.spotlight: Formerly smart at about 2m and has won several notable prizes; well into the veteran stage and is on a near two-year losing spell but ran quite encouragingly returned to 2m4f in the Peterborough Chase at Huntingdon most recently, keeping on for second behind the favourite; possibilities on favourable terms kept to this distance/grade.

runners.comment: Comfortably best in competitive events the last twice; making good progress; respected
runners.name: French Ship
runners.spotlight: Comfortably the best in competitive 2m4f events at Cheltenham (good to soft) and Newbury (soft) the last twice, taking record in completed starts since handicapping to 2-2 and strike-rate over hurdles to 4-7; another big rise in the weights reflects his excellent progress; respected.

runners.comment: Won the Challow as a novice hurdler; returns from lengthy absence
runners.name: Captain Teague
runners.spotlight: Absent since finishing lame at Newbury in November 2024, truncating a novice chase campaign; smart previously and has Grade 1 form, including a success in the Challow (2m4f, soft) as a novice hurdler; 2-4 in this sphere; on a workable mark provided he retains ability.

runners.comment: Failed to complete in last three starts; steadily progressive otherwise
runners.name: Double Powerful
runners.spotlight: Comes with some risk, having failed to complete in last three starts, latest switched back to hurdles from fences; steadily progressive otherwise, having performed well four times (including over C&D) after completing a six-timer; in the mix, provided he manages to get round.

runners.comment: Useful on his day but has questions marks over current form and the trip
runners.name: Iberico Lord
runners.spotlight: Bagged a couple of major 2m handicaps in the 2023-24 campaign and subsequently won over fences at Kempton (2m2f); out of sorts since returned to hurdles, however; has question marks over current form and the new trip.

runners.comment: Has form in notable handicaps over hurdles; fourth in Coral Cup in sole 2m5f run
runners.name: Beat The Bat
runners.spotlight: Looked unsuited by the drop back to 2m1f on chase debut last time, though wasn't disgraced on the figures; respectable form in notable handicap hurdles otherwise in 2025, including fourth in the Coral Cup at Cheltenham in sole 2m5f attempt; frame possibilities.

runners.comment: Recorded easy wins in last two appearances; improving hurdler who has major claims
runners.name: Lanesborough
runners.spotlight: Record of 2211 since handicapping, the wins gained easily at Warwick (2m3f, soft) and Doncaster (2m, good to soft); latter form received a boost when the runner-up went one better in Kempton event at Christmas; bred to be as effective at this new trip; improving hurdler who has major claims.

runners.comment: Form dipped in last two outings; something to prove back up in trip
runners.name: Wreckless Eric
runners.spotlight: Steady progress at about 2m culminated in close second in last season's Imperial Cup; form has dipped in two subsequent starts, the penultimate over 2m4f; has something to prove back up in distance.

runners.comment: 4-6 since being partnered by Chad Bament but needs further progress
runners.name: King Of The Lake
runners.spotlight: Versatile; after two defeats he regained the winning thread at Chepstow (2m7f, good to soft) most recently, taking record since being partnered by Chad Bament to 4-6; needs further progress to follow up in this field but that's not impossible.

runners.comment: Not sure to back up latest effort; losing run is mounting up
runners.name: Ike Sport
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent form this term; respectable second at Wincanton (3m) most recently but isn't certain to back up that effort, let alone go one better; losing run is mounting up and this is a stiffer assignment.

runners.comment: Ex-Irish; not solid on his form (hurdles/fences) for new yard
runners.name: Krak
runners.spotlight: Sole attempt in a handicap hurdle resulted in Cork success (2m3f) on final Irish outing; faces a tougher task in this field, however, and isn't particularly solid on his form (hurdles/fences) for new stable.

runners.comment: Front-runner; in form but isn't sure to get an easy lead in this big field
runners.name: Goodwin
runners.spotlight: Front-runner whose strike-rate is 5-15, the most recent win at Plumpton (2m4f, good) in November; creditable second at Ascot (2m5f, soft) since; in form but an easy lead isn't certain in this big field.

runners.comment: 3-4 since switched to hurdles; yard has won the last two runnings of this race; big player
runners.name: A Pai De Nom
runners.owner: Cherry Knoll Farm M Ward & D Skelton
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-4 since switched to hurdles features a success in big field at Cheltenham (2m5f, soft) in sole handicap attempt; followed up at Leicester (1m7f) last time, while shaping as if he'll relish this step back up in trip; yard has landed the last two runnings (2023 and 2024) of this prize; strong credentials.

runners.comment: 2-3 in France; folded tamely on British debut but may still have more to offer
runners.name: Just Ennemi
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-3 over hurdles in France, then sold for £320,000 at the David Maxwell dispersal; folded tamely when favourite for Haydock chase (2m5f) on British/seasonal debut but may resume progress with the outing under his belt; remains of interest.

runners.comment: Appeared to have plenty in hand at Hereford last time; interesting upped further in trip
runners.name: Came From Nowhere
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 7yo whose solid record reads 133321; just nudged out and appeared to have plenty in hand with tongue-tie applied at Hereford (2m3f, soft; second handicap attempt and first go beyond 2m) most recently; interesting upped further in distance, with additional progress on the cards.

runners.comment: 2-2 since being partnered by Olive Nicholls; still quite unexposed at this sort of trip
runners.name: Fasol
runners.owner: P J Vogt And Bryan Drew
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-13 over hurdles; 2-2 since being partnered by Olive Nicholls, namely wins in Wincanton novice hurdle (1m7f, good) and Musselburgh handicap (2m4f, good to soft); still reasonably unexposed at this sort of trip; career-high mark is not insurmountable in the hat-trick bid.

runners.breeder: Sas Elevage Du Haras De Bourgeauville
runners.comment: Scored readily at Warwick last time but this is a tougher assignment
runners.name: Yellow Star
runners.owner: Tim Lord Kc And G L Moore
runners.spotlight: Registered a ready success in Class 4 contest at Warwick (2m5f, good to soft) last time, bouncing back from a dismal effort behind Goodwin at Plumpton; had seemed fairly exposed and may struggle off career-high mark at this stronger level.

runners.comment: Lightly raced; only fifth in Taunton handicap on reappearance but may do better
runners.name: Just A Rose
runners.owner: Mrs Jennifer Irish Kate & Andrew Brooks
runners.spotlight: Lack of experience counted against her at the Cheltenham Festival (2-2 previously, namely point/hurdle wins); only fifth in Taunton handicap (2m3f) on reappearance but may do better with the outing under her belt.

15:53.race_name: Coral "Pipped-At-The-Post" Payouts Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Posted a career-best performance over C&D at Christmas, scoring comfortably; respected
runners.name: Williethebuilder
runners.spotlight: Posted a career-best performance in similar event over C&D (good) at Christmas, scoring comfortably and taking form figures for new stable to 6321; respected with 8lb rise not insurmountable.

runners.comment: Returns to hurdles; record of 2-2 at Kempton includes a win in this race two years ago
runners.name: Rare Edition
runners.spotlight: Rather mixed results since scoring on chase debut; has a record of 2-2 at Kempton, both wins over hurdles, including this race off 7lb higher two years ago; interesting returned to this sphere/course.

runners.comment: Rather all-or-nothing for current yard; not a solid option
runners.name: Washington
runners.spotlight: Rather all-or-nothing for current yard, winning three times but soundly beaten in five other outings, latest in the C&D event won by Williethebuilder; not a solid option.

runners.comment: Huntingdon win last time took his record to 4-11; may be capable of better still
runners.name: Were Red And Blue
runners.spotlight: Bounced back and registered a success at Huntingdon (2m, soft) with reappearance under his belt, taking record to 4-11; this second-season hurdler may be capable of better still; in the mix.

runners.breeder: L Dulong R Bonaventure & B Dulong
runners.comment: Form has dipped since reappearance effort; others look stronger at present
runners.name: King William Rufus
runners.spotlight: Scored twice last term and ran respectably on reappearance but form has dipped in two subsequent starts, latest in lower grade; others look stronger at present.

runners.comment: Skelton runner who looks open to progress now handicapping and is firmly in calculations
runners.name: Quaviste
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; creditable second at Market Rasen (2m) in latest attempt in novice hurdles; this Skelton runner looks open to progress now handicapping and is firmly in calculations.

runners.comment: Ran well in first-time hood at Doncaster most recently; may remain competitive
runners.name: Courageous Strike
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-5 since switched to hurdles; ran well in first-time hood at Doncaster (2m; three ran) most recently; back in a deeper field but may remain competitive in the retained headgear.

runners.comment: Has taken his form to a new level since wearing tongue-tie; could go well
runners.name: Oakleys Way
runners.spotlight: Has taken his form to a new level since wearing tongue-tie, winning at Taunton (2m3f, good to firm) then creditable third at Wincanton (1m7f, soft); could go well off bottom weight upped further in grade.

12:45.race_name: Total Metal Recovery "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: Dr V Roger-Yves Simon & Nicolas Simon &
runners.comment: Made the frame in bumpers; fifth in big field at Exeter switched to hurdles yesterday
runners.name: A King Of Magic
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in a couple of bumpers (trained by Tom Weston on debut); again showed ability when fifth in big field at Exeter (2m, good to soft) switched to hurdles yesterday; remains open to progress.

runners.comment: 125-1 and always behind when pulled up on debut in maiden hurdle at Wincanton last month
runners.name: Blazing Gaden
runners.spotlight: 125-1 and always behind when pulled up on debut in maiden hurdle at Wincanton (1m7f, soft) last month.

runners.comment: 78,000euros 3yo but he was tailed off at 150-1 on last month's debut at Hereford
runners.name: Blazing Saint
runners.spotlight: 78,000euros 3yo whose dam was a bumper/2m4f hurdle winner (RPR 120), but he was tailed off at 150-1 on last month's debut at Hereford.

runners.comment: Close third on debut in bumper in November 2024 but merely ninth on both outings since
runners.name: Collanisi
runners.spotlight: Close third on debut in Ffos Las bumper (2m, soft) in November 2024 and he remains lightly raced, but he's finished merely ninth on both outings since, more recently at 33-1 on last month's hurdle debut at Exeter.

runners.comment: Point winner who has been placed on both hurdle starts and is a major player today
runners.name: Gee Force Flyer
runners.spotlight: Point winner (3m, yielding) who was placed at Ffos Las in the autumn on his first two hurdle starts (2m4f, soft); major player today.

runners.comment: From a family his yard has done very well with but bred to come into his own over further
runners.name: Georgemani
runners.spotlight: 14l fifth of ten on debut in point-to-point bumper (2m, good) last March; from a family his trainer has done very well with but he's bred to come into his own over further.

runners.name: Johnnys Jury
runners.owner: Blazing Blues Rc Hurlers On The Ditch

runners.comment: Yet to reproduce useful bumper form over hurdles but could benefit from this longer trip
runners.name: Kilwaughter
runners.spotlight: Yet to reproduce his useful bumper form over hurdles (two attempts) but he kept on for 21l fourth of 16 in a warm novice at Exeter (2m, good to soft) last month, and he could benefit from this longer trip; interesting.

runners.comment: Promise in both bumpers and brings potential to hurdle/stable debut; he's one to consider
runners.name: Mondouiboy
runners.spotlight: Point runner-up (3m, soft to heavy) who showed promise for Harry Derham in both bumpers (2m/2m3f, heavy/yielding); sold for £115,000 in October; brings potential to this hurdle/stable debut and he's one to consider.

runners.comment: Promise on first two starts; a lesser run followed but he failed to settle; not ruled out
runners.name: My Own Lovely Lee
runners.spotlight: Third in a point (3m, yielding) on debut and again showed ability when 20l fourth of ten on hurdle debut in warm maiden at Chepstow (2m3f, good to soft) in November; a lesser run followed at Leicester but on different ground (soft) and he failed to settle; retains potential; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Sold for £155k after point win; well-held 2nd on hurdle debut; could be capable of better
runners.name: Shotgun Rider
runners.spotlight: Won Irish maiden point (3m, good) on debut last May and bought for £155,000 later that month; well-beaten second on hurdle debut at Leicester (2m4f, soft) last month but could be capable of better and he might be a contender in a first-time tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Game success in Haydock bumper for Don Cantillon; open to progress; interesting
runners.name: So Proud
runners.spotlight: Recorded a game success in good-ground bumper at Haydock last May in sole start for Don Cantillon; sold for £100,000 later that month; open to progress and looks interesting, especially if the market speaks favourably.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Southwell and pedigree provides optimism regarding the step up in trip
runners.name: Sutherland
runners.spotlight: Improved form when runner-up at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month on his second stable/hurdle start; his pedigree provides optimism regarding this step up in trip and he's in with a chance.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras DEnki
runners.comment: Consistent across his four starts but others are likely to have greater potential
runners.name: Tao Enki
runners.spotlight: Consistent across his four starts and was 1l behind Shotgun Rider when 17l third at Leicester (2m4f, soft) last month; others are likely to have greater potential.

runners.comment: Backed at big prices on debut at Wetherby but beaten 33l in eighth of 14
runners.name: Ciao Bellisima
runners.spotlight: Backed at big prices prior to last month's debut at Wetherby (2m3f, soft), when beaten 33l in eighth of 14; a big step forward is needed.

runners.comment: Has shown ability when fourth on all three starts but improvement is needed today
runners.name: Yeld To Call
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability when fourth on all three starts, most recently her hurdle debut over C&D (good to soft); she's had wind surgery since; improvement is needed if she's to pose a serious threat today.

13:15.race_name: William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: On a handy mark on hurdle form but tailed off here on last month's chase debut
runners.name: Gold For Alec
runners.spotlight: On a handy mark on his hurdle form and he ran well in that sphere in October; however, well beaten next time and tailed off on last month's chase debut here; needs to leave that latest performance miles behind.

runners.comment: Beaten on last 11 starts but went close at Ludlow latest; leading claims if backing it up
runners.name: Pepe Le Moko
runners.spotlight: Beaten on his last 11 starts but he's dropped down the weights and returned to form with a near-miss at Ludlow (2m4f, good to soft) last month; has won on soft/good to soft; leading claims if backing up his last run.

runners.comment: Went close on chase debut at Kelso & could improve again now up in trip; high on the list
runners.name: Moon Phases
runners.spotlight: All five runs on soft ground; took another step forward when going close on his handicap/chase debut at Kelso (2m1f); appeals as a type who will improve again now upped in trip and this unexposed 7yo is high on the list.

runners.comment: Two chase wins but remains 6lb above last winning mark and returns from some time off
runners.name: Always Busy
runners.spotlight: Two chase wins (3m1f/3m, good to soft/good), the latest in a small field last May; however, he needs to prove this 6lb higher mark isn't beyond him; absent since falling at Worcester in July.

runners.breeder: E U R L Agb Agency & Mrs D Billebaut
runners.comment: Well beaten on chase debut but remains lightly raced and is with a top stable
runners.name: Jack Black
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on handicap/chase debut at Bangor (2m1f, heavy) in November on ground that shouldn't have been an issue; it's hard to be confident on the back of that but he's shown promise for his top yard and remains lightly raced; no surprise if he bounces back with a bold show.

runners.comment: Better than ever after this visor went on; career-high mark but has to be respected
runners.name: Atreides
runners.spotlight: Better than ever since swapping cheekpieces for a visor last month, winning at Plumpton (2m4f, good to soft) and Fontwell (2m3f, heavy); early faller at Wincanton on Boxing Day; on career-high mark but has to be respected.

runners.comment: Still early days and well backed last time, but has been well beaten on both chase starts
runners.name: Rule Me In
runners.spotlight: 3m point runner-up who won 2m maiden hurdle at Southwell last February; still early days over fences and backed into favouritism at Windsor last time, but he's now been soundly beaten in both chases; has to raise his game.

runners.comment: Back to form when second on stable debut at Huntingdon but lesser run followed at Haydock
runners.name: Carrigmoorna Rowan
runners.spotlight: 9yo who is lightly raced for his age; returned to form when second on stable debut at Huntingdon (2m4f, good to soft) in November but a lesser run followed at Haydock (2m4f, good to soft); needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Overtook three rivals after the final fence to win over 2m at Lingfield four weeks ago
runners.name: A Great Excuse
runners.spotlight: Won when dropped back in trip at Lingfield (2m, good to soft) four weeks ago on his second stable/chase start; up in distance today but it could prove to be a positive as he overtook three rivals after the final fence last time, and that form is working out nicely; he's one to consider up 5lb.

runners.comment: Runner-up on chase debut and he could be the type to benefit from the cheekpieces
runners.name: Bank On Frank
runners.spotlight: Point runner-up who improved for the switch to fences when second at Fontwell (2m5f, good to soft) in November, having been outpaced; he could be sharper now in cheekpieces and is in good hands to progress; chance.

runners.breeder: Ecurie Domaine De Baune Francois Thomas
runners.comment: 5yo who has been runner-up on last two starts but without threatening and he's now 0-10
runners.name: Le Galli Bier
runners.spotlight: 5yo who has been runner-up over fences on his last two starts (2m4f/2m3f, good to soft/heavy) but he's failed to threaten the winner on either occasion (Atreides last time) and needs something extra to get off the mark.

runners.comment: Excellent campaign last season but he's struggled on both runs this term
runners.name: Ideallko
runners.spotlight: Enjoyed an excellent campaign last season and he's well handicapped on that form; one to watch in the betting but he's struggled on both runs this term and a major turnaround is necessary.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Ffos Las then unsuited by going right-handed at Leicester most recently
runners.name: Dj Pete
runners.spotlight: 8yo who made it 0-12 when soundly beaten at Leicester a fortnight ago but he jumped to the left at that right-handed track; runner-up to thriving winner at Ffos Las (2m3f, soft) two starts ago and he could have a part to play now going back left-handed; effective on good and soft ground.

13:52.race_name: William Hill Price Boosts Every Day Hampton Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Was hard work at Cheltenham but now 2-2 over fences after that Listed win; key player
runners.name: Wade Out
runners.spotlight: Beat subsequent Grade 2 winner Wendigo on chase debut at Worcester (2m4f, good) in October and followed up in Listed novice at Cheltenham (3m1f, soft), despite some slow jumps and being the first to come under pressure; concedes weight all round but this unbeaten chaser is still a key player.

runners.comment: No match for winner in Grade 2 at Sandown last month but could be in the mix today
runners.name: Doyen Quest
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has raced five times over fences with two wins (2m4f/3m, good; including here); no match for the winner when second of four in Grade 2 at Sandown (3m, good to soft) last month but it was still a good run and he could be in the mix for top trainer who has won the last two runnings.

runners.comment: Looked ponderous at Sandown when behind Doyen Quest but he's unexposed and could improve
runners.name: Laurens Bay
runners.spotlight: 2-5 over hurdles (soft/good to soft) and won a match on chase debut at Uttoxeter (3m, good) in October; looked ponderous when third of four in Grade 2 at Sandown (3m, good to soft) last month and has about 4l to find with Doyen Quest on that form, but he's unexposed and open to improvement.

runners.comment: Steadily run race at Doncaster didn't play to strengths; could have plenty more to offer
runners.name: Moon Rocket
runners.spotlight: Useful novice hurdler last season (won on soft) and he scored easily on November's chase debut at Doncaster (3m, good to soft); narrowly beaten in a match there (3m, good to soft) since but that steadily run race didn't play to his strengths; could have plenty more to offer over fences.

runners.comment: Impressed on chase debut then beaten at Cheltenham; needs to take a step forward today
runners.name: The Jukebox Kid
runners.spotlight: Heavy-ground point winner who impressed in a handicap on chase debut at Carlisle (2m5f, good to soft) in November; didn't see out Cheltenham's stiff, extended 3m1f when fourth of eight in a handicap four weeks ago (good to soft); today's slightly shorter trip can help and this very lightly raced 7yo retains potential, but he needs to take a step forward to win this.

runners.comment: Plenty of promise on both chase starts and going left-handed could be a firm plus
runners.name: Hollygrove Cha Cha
runners.spotlight: Grade 2 mares' novice hurdle winner (2m4f, soft) who kept on well for third of four in warm Listed Intermediate Chase at stiff Carlisle (2m4f, good to soft) in November; won mares' novice at Exeter (2m1f, heavy) since; this step up in trip is well worth a go (half-sister to 2m7f winner) and the switch to a left-handed track could be a firm plus; in calculations.

14:25.race_name: William Hill Racing Each Way Extra Handicap Hurdle

runners.breeder: Dr A Bolte U Dr H H Leimbach
runners.comment: Hereford winner over further; never involved off this mark back over 2m last time
runners.name: Oakley
runners.spotlight: Showed improvement to win well at Hereford (2m3f, good) but never threatened to get involved back over 2m at Chepstow off this 8lb higher mark.

runners.comment: Well handicapped but finished tired when out of the money at Taunton on Thursday
runners.name: Time Interval
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped now but finished tired when out of the money at Taunton on Thursday (first-time cheekpieces) where the rain was no help; ideally wants goodish ground.

runners.comment: Was running quite well when last seen in the summer but over 2m4f
runners.name: Ukantango
runners.spotlight: Was running quite well when last seen in the summer but over 2m4f and gives the impression that he might stay further than that; lacking a run and back at 2m, he's worth taking on.

runners.comment: Raised 11lb for easy Uttoxeter win last time but he's looking very progressive
runners.name: Soldiers Leap
runners.spotlight: Good value for his narrow winning margins at Stratford (2m2f, good to soft) and Uttoxeter (2m, soft), latterly with a hood joining a tongue-tie; raised 11lb for that but he's looking very progressive.

runners.comment: His qualifying runs weren't too shoddy and he departed mid-race on handicap debut
runners.name: Sea Warrior
runners.spotlight: His qualifying runs weren't too shoddy and he departed mid-race on handicap debut after clipping heels; a bit worrying that he was easy to back that day at 14-1 but he retains plenty of upside.

runners.comment: Back at 2m and now handicapping, he could be a player with Sean Bowen booked
runners.name: Dr Waksman
runners.spotlight: Competitive on the Flat but never won a race; early days over hurdles; he was second at Plumpton last February (2m, soft) and didn't appear to stay 2m4f on his return to jumping last month; back at 2m and now handicapping, he could be a player with Sean Bowen booked.

runners.comment: Beaten about 10l in his last two handicaps and doesn't look the percentage call
runners.name: Knight Templar
runners.spotlight: Close up at Exeter three runs back but beaten about 10l in his subsequent handicaps and doesn't look the percentage call.

runners.comment: Has had a lot of racing and hasn't been at his best in two runs since leaving James Owen
runners.name: Tara Iti
runners.spotlight: Has had a lot of racing and hasn't been at his best in two runs since leaving James Owen; can be taken on.

runners.comment: Placed in maidens and might not be on a bad mark for this handicap debut
runners.name: Three Pikes
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who made the frame in his three maidens (2m2f-2m4f) and might not be on a bad mark for this handicap debut, especially with Freddie Keighley taking away 7lb; could be interesting despite his absence.

runners.comment: Finishing tailed off on stable/handicap debut at Uttoxeter leaves him with much to prove
runners.name: Jiair Madrik
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler in France who also tried fences in two of his five starts there; finishing tailed off on stable/handicap debut at Uttoxeter leaves him with too much to prove.

runners.comment: Could do with sharpening up his jumping and his best form was over an extended 2m3f
runners.name: At The Oche
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who has made a solid start over hurdles, though his best run was over Ascot's extended 2m3f and he was readily outpaced when beaten 8l over 2m at Kempton (both those runs in handicaps); could do with sharpening up his jumping.

runners.comment: Successful in France; questionable what she achieved in a Uttoxeter novice
runners.name: Best Women
runners.spotlight: Third behind a long odds-on favourite in a novice that lacked any depth at Uttoxeter and questionable what she achieved there; however, that was after a long absence and she won on the Flat and over fences in France; couldn't put a line through her.

runners.comment: Won at Uttoxeter in May but very little to take out of his three runs following a break
runners.name: Maple
runners.owner: R Whitelock L Clemitson & R Jefferson
runners.spotlight: Won at Uttoxeter in May but very little to take out of his three runs following a break; has to turn a corner.

runners.comment: Can be too free but still won well at Doncaster and dropping back to 2m could help
runners.name: Kelijoe
runners.spotlight: Again raced too freely but still won with something up his sleeve at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft) and the runner up, beaten nearly 4l, was clear of the third; open to further progress off this 7lb higher mark and dropping back in trip shouldn't hurt.

runners.comment: Slow ground was no excuse for nothing runs last twice; hard to trust after those efforts
runners.name: Snapius
runners.spotlight: Flat/hurdle winner in Ireland; only 1-15 for current yard and slow ground was no excuse for nothing runs the last twice; hard to trust after those efforts.

runners.comment: He could turn things around now into handicaps and with a tongue-tie fitted
runners.name: Run Away Joe
runners.spotlight: Placed in Irish points; essentially underwhelming under rules but he could turn things around now into handicaps and with a tongue-tie fitted; the betting may tell a tale.

runners.comment: Some promise in novice events but was 22-1 when pulled up on handicap debut
runners.name: Mexican Stan
runners.spotlight: Hinted at promise in novice hurdles but was pulled up on his return/handicap debut at Huntingdon (2m4f; 22-1); now has tongue tied.

runners.comment: Went up 8lb for Taunton despite being all out; 4yo armed with his age allowance
runners.name: Premier
runners.spotlight: Flat background; only his second run in a handicap when all out to win at Taunton (2m, good) and an 8lb rise seems harsh; however, he is only a 4yo and armed with his age allowance; has to be considered.

14:55.race_name: William Hill Half A Mill Classic Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: In rallying for second over extended 3m2f last time, he's never looked a stronger stayer
runners.name: LHomme Presse
runners.spotlight: Goes well on soft, unraced on heavy; high-class chaser of long standing, absent 300 days when second of nine at Cheltenham (extended 3m2f) four weeks ago in his first handicap since 2022; looked like dropping right out at one point that day (some sketchy jumping didn't help) so in rallying for second he's never looked a stronger stayer, but this is significantly further.

runners.comment: Stays all day and goes well in the mud; up another 3lb but he keeps digging deep
runners.name: Mr Vango
runners.spotlight: Hat-trick last term culminated in 4m2f Midlands National at Uttoxeter (good to soft; goes well in the mud); usually front-runner but he had to chase the leader at Aintree (3m2f, soft) on reappearance and, although it looked very hard work, he plugged on to such good effect that he went down by just a short head; this step back up in trip has to be a big help; the forecast rain will be too and, although he's gone up another 3lb, he keeps digging deep.

runners.comment: Won big handicap over extended 3m4f at Sandown last April; disappointing on latest start
runners.name: Resplendent Grey
runners.spotlight: Bagged a 2m4f Listed contest at Carlisle (good to soft) on return, following up his success in the big end-of-season handicap over an extended 3m4f at Sandown (good; also acts on soft) in April; however, his bid for another major prize at Newbury (3m2f; 9-1) six weeks ago was disappointing, slowly into his stride, and he needs to bounce back with another career best.

runners.breeder: S A R L Genetique Obstacle
runners.comment: Every bit of rain/snow should help in theory but a huge turnaround is needed after wind op
runners.name: Nassalam
runners.spotlight: Won 2023 Welsh National by 34l on heavy going and has the same mark today; however, he failed to shine in the Gold Cup or Grand National later in that campaign, before pulled up on last four starts and the latest was despite a return to soft ground (from good); had wind surgery in November and every bit of rain or snow should help in theory, but a huge turnaround is needed.

runners.comment: Dominant at 2025 Cheltenham Festival; new trip; it's his falls which are the chief worry
runners.name: Myretown
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has had four falls in 12 appearances, including when he crashed out at the ninth as favourite for major 3m2f handicap at Newbury in November; progressive otherwise and signed off last term with a dominant performance in the Ultima at the Cheltenham Festival (3m1f, good to soft; act on soft); 15lb higher today (and over a markedly new trip) but won that race so well that it's probably the falls which are the chief worry.

runners.comment: Shapes as if well worth another attempt beyond 3m; visor replaces his usual cheekpieces
runners.name: Destroytheevidence
runners.spotlight: Disappointing in December 2024 over an extended 3m1f and that's the furthest he's been; however, he shapes as if well worth another attempt beyond 3m and, although he's made little improvement in his eight-race chase career, he was back near his best on latest outing and one of his peak performances was over 3m on soft at this track; visor replaces his usual cheekpieces; needs a second look.

runners.comment: Didn't shout stamina last time (3m); 3lb out of handicap; last had headgear in spring 2024
runners.name: Joyeux Machin
runners.spotlight: 2023 Irish chase winner who ran over hurdles for Dan Skelton until his good fourth of seven over fences at Doncaster (3m, good to soft; probably acts on heavy) four weeks ago under Harry Atkins; that was second run after wind surgery; he didn't exactly shout stamina that day and is now 3lb out of the handicap; cheekpieces (he last wore headgear in spring 2024) return.

runners.breeder: S A R L Haras Du Bois Emery
runners.comment: 4lb out of handicap; going beyond 3m1f for first time asks a big question for this 12yo
runners.name: Torn And Frayed
runners.spotlight: Acts on soft, runner-up twice in maiden hurdles on heavy; won at Aintree (3m1f, good) in October; runner-up here (3m) and at Cheltenham (2m4f) since but he's 4lb out of the handicap today (5lb claimer is recruited) and going beyond 3m1f for the first time asks a big question for this 12yo.

runners.comment: 2024 Welsh National winner; close to best last time; 6lb out of handicap but e-w claims
runners.name: Val Dancer
runners.spotlight: Won Welsh National at Chepstow (3m6f, soft; acts on heavy) in December 2024; promoted second in the Grand National Trial at Haydock and close to his best when never-nearer third in the Becher at Aintree (3m2f; nearly 4l behind Mr Vango) five weeks ago; position 6lb out of the handicap is the big problem today but he should give his running and has each-way claims.

15:32.race_name: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: S C E A Hamel Stud
runners.comment: Another 3lb lower today and a 10lb claimer is recruited, but there have to be some doubts
runners.name: Botox Has
runners.spotlight: Two Grade 2 wins over about 3m on testing ground in the 2023-24 campaign but there was only one performance of a similar calibre last season; went well long way at Wincanton on Boxing Day (a rare run these days away from Graded events) and possibly needed the race; 3lb lower today and a 10lb claimer is recruited, but there have to be some doubts.

runners.comment: There's a bit to prove over this new trip but recent form puts him on the shortlist
runners.name: Ludor
runners.spotlight: Both wins on soft, by a very wide margin when he made all at Bangor (2m3f) on handicap/seasonal debut; good third of 16 over nearly 2m5f at Newbury (soft; up 3lb today) 17 days later, when two rivals passed him on the run-in; there's a bit to prove over this new trip but recent form puts him on the shortlist.

runners.comment: Won last March off just 1lb lower; soundly beaten on both starts since
runners.name: Red Risk
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Xliv & A&j Ryan
runners.spotlight: Veteran who showed he's still capable of useful form when winning in a big field at Uttoxeter (2m7f, good to soft; acts on soft) last March off just 1lb lower; soundly beaten on both starts since (off nearly eight months in between) and a more positive recent run would be preferred.

runners.comment: Needs to bounce back from a disappointing show four weeks ago; running well before that
runners.name: Long Draw
runners.spotlight: Second in his only race here; made very good progress last season, winning at Cheltenham in December and April, and also ran well for minor honours on first three starts (one on soft) this term; however, he needs to bounce back from a disappointing show four weeks ago.

runners.comment: Reappearance should have blown away a few cobwebs but others have more pressing claims
runners.name: Green Book
runners.owner: Lady Price C Shaw C Boylan & I Tagg
runners.spotlight: Acts on soft; his two best days came when winning the same major 2m7f handicap at Sandown in February 2022 and 2023; absent 996 days before making most there (14-1) five weeks ago but ending pulled up; while that should have blown away a few cobwebs, others have more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Return to hurdling (best form was at 3m on soft) means that he needs a second look
runners.name: Doughmore Bay
runners.spotlight: Returned from a long absence with an encouraging third of five at Windsor in November; bad mistake at the second seemingly put paid to his chase debut four weeks ago but this return to hurdling (in which sphere his best form was at 3m on soft) means that he needs a second look.

runners.comment: Reappearance was after 434 days off and over only 2m5f; could be interesting this time
runners.name: Lord Snootie
runners.spotlight: 3m+ in the mud holds no fears if he's on a good day, which he wasn't at Ascot three weeks ago but that was after 434 days off and over only 2m5f; won his only start here (2022; his last win), has been dropped another 2lb and his yard is among the winners, so he could be interesting.

runners.comment: Fair sixth last time on his third run after wind surgery; more to prove back in the mud
runners.name: Tranquil Sea
runners.spotlight: Won Irish maiden in the mud in 2024 and at Chepstow (3m, good) in October on second run for new yard; disappointment next time was followed by wind surgery, since which he's been a good second at Market Rasen (near 3m; good to soft) and fair sixth at Cheltenham (3m); more to prove back in the mud.

runners.comment: Has had wind surgery and is on her last winning mark; first run under a 7lb claimer
runners.name: Felicie Du Maquis
runners.spotlight: Dual point and three-time hurdle winner, most recently at Ffos Las (3m, soft) last April; tongue tied this season, when suffering a heavy defeat on reappearance and still below form five weeks ago, but that's been followed by wind surgery and she's back to her last winning mark; first run under a 7lb claimer; case can be made for this lightly raced 11yo.

runners.comment: Second-season hurdler; questions to answer at present, including on this step up in trip
runners.name: Rubber Ball
runners.spotlight: Second-season hurdler (best effort to win on soft last term); ran well for a long way at Aintree (2m4f, soft) in early December but again didn't see it out over that C&D when well held on Boxing Day; should come good again at some stage off a falling mark but he has questions to answer at the moment, including on this step up in trip.

runners.comment: Running well prior to his early fall nine days ago; needs respect
runners.name: Spike Jones
runners.spotlight: Used to act in the mud; ridden on last four starts by Benjamin Macey, beaten a nose at Lingfield (2m7f) on reappearance and bang there again at Cheltenham (3m, good to soft) in December; fell early there nine days ago; has crept back up the weights but needs respect.

16:02.race_name: Racing To School Celebrating 25 Years Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: £3,000 yearling; half-brother to two winners but he may be one for further down the line
runners.name: All Good To Go
runners.spotlight: £3,000 yearling; eighth foal; half-brother to winners Artic Row (2m-2m4f hurdle/chase; RPR 122) and Artic Mann (2m6f/3m2f hurdle; 112); dam 2m/2m1f hurdle/chase winner (130); he may be one for further down the line.

runners.comment: Sixth foal; dam twice-raced sprint maiden; a watching brief is advised on debut
runners.name: Arizona Moon
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; dam twice-raced sprint maiden, closely related to useful 6f-1m winner; wears a tongue-tie on debut and a watching brief is advised.

runners.breeder: Haras De La Haie Neuve & S Bouvier
runners.comment: Half-brother to useful bumper winner; trainer very much among the winners on the Flat
runners.name: Country Pursuits
runners.spotlight: 28,000euros 3yo; fifth foal; half-brother to winners Homme D'Un Soir (bumper and 2m/2m1f hurdle/chase; RPR 131) and For Friendship (French 9.7f 2yo/1m2f Flat and 2m1f hurdle); dam French 1m/1m1f winner; trainer very much among the winners on the Flat; not ruled out on debut.

runners.comment: Has shown ability in a point/C&D bumper & he's open to improvement; each-way possibilities
runners.name: Current Edition
runners.spotlight: In the mix when falling at final fence on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, good to yielding) last April; failed to settle and faded into fifth on last month's bumper debut over C&D (good to soft; about 1l behind Sassella Storm); open to improvement and holds each-way possibilities.

runners.comment: Top trainer does well in bumpers and he's one to be interested in on debut
runners.name: Diamond Street
runners.spotlight: 11,500euros foal; second foal; dam bumper/2m1f hurdle winner (RPR 113), out of 1m2f AW winning sister to St Leger winner Bob's Return; top trainer does well in bumpers and he's one to be interested in on debut.

runners.comment: Sold for £100,000 after winning Irish point on debut; firmly in calculations
runners.name: Loch Ness Pineau
runners.spotlight: Won on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, good) in October and subsequently sold for £100,000; new trainer enjoys plenty of success in bumpers and he's firmly in calculations on this first rules start.

runners.comment: Won Irish point on second start then sold for £42,000; could have a part to play
runners.name: McElhattan
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, yielding to soft) in October then went one better in November (3m, soft to heavy), after which he was sold for £42,000; could have a part to play on this first bumper start.

runners.comment: Encouraging fourth over C&D on debut; wind op since; possible improver; not ruled out
runners.name: Sassella Storm
runners.owner: The One We Came For Partnership
runners.spotlight: 15-2 when fading into fourth of 12 on debut over C&D (good to soft) last month, about 1l ahead of Current Edition; wind op since; his dam was a Listed Flat winner and he's a possible improver; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Sold for £120,000 since winning Irish mares' maiden point; could be a serious force
runners.name: Britway Belle
runners.spotlight: Won Irish mares' maiden point (3m, yielding) on debut in October and subsequently changed hands for £120,000; takes on males on bumper debut but could be a serious force, especially if strong in the betting.

runners.comment: 8,000euros foal; dam unraced half-sister to point/h'dle winner; others are more compelling
runners.name: Scaredofnothing
runners.spotlight: Newcomer; 8,000euros foal; second foal; dam unraced half-sister to point/2m hurdle winner Little Token (RPR 105), out of bumper and 2m hurdle/2m3f chase winner (105); others have more compelling claims.

11:40.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap

runners.comment: C&D winner whose record under Myla Coppins reads 1331; right there off just 2lb higher
runners.name: Francesi
runners.spotlight: Just held on to win by a short head at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) nine days ago, taking his record under Myla Coppins to 1331; his other career win came over C&D so he should again be right there off just 2lb higher; one of three from stable.

runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: 0-12 and getting no closer to winning despite a falling mark; stamina remains questionable
runners.name: Reddeef
runners.spotlight: 0-12 and getting no closer to winning despite a falling mark; stamina for this far remains questionable to boot; tongue-tie returns.

runners.comment: Without a win on the AW since March 2023 and may just need this after three months off
runners.name: Poetic Force
runners.spotlight: Veteran who took advantage of his lower turf mark when winning twice at Brighton (7f/1m) last summer; without a win on the AW since March 2023 and may just need this after three months off.

runners.comment: Both wins on Polytrack came over 7f, but stays this far; third at Wolverhampton on Tuesday
runners.name: Super Hit
runners.spotlight: Dual Chelmsford winner (7f, Polytrack) who is just as effective over this far; has dropped to a fair mark and did well to keep on for third of ten at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) on Tuesday given he was free; each-way claims again.

runners.comment: Has been successful on her last four visits here; just 2lb higher and very much a player
runners.name: Dandy Khan
runners.spotlight: Has been successful on her last four visits here, the latest when just hanging on by a short head over 7f a week ago (fourth won back here on Wednesday); just 2lb higher and very much a player in her current mood.

runners.comment: Has mainly run well since winning at Southwell in November; shortlisted
runners.name: Amber Honey
runners.spotlight: Consistent filly who has mainly run well since winning off 3lb lower at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) in November, including when fourth of eight at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) 11 days ago after having got upset in the stalls; shortlisted.

runners.comment: In good form lately, but up another 2lb and the return to this trip is a concern
runners.name: Three On Thursday
runners.spotlight: Made it 12th-time lucky with a convincing success here (1m2f) last month and only went down narrowly at Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) 12 days later; clearly in top form, but up another 2lb and the return to this trip is a concern.

runners.comment: Losing run up to 22 despite a falling mark; recent runs don't suggest he is about to win
runners.name: City Of York
runners.spotlight: Losing run up to 22 despite a plummeting mark and recent efforts don't suggest he is about to end the drought.

runners.comment: Best form has come over shorter and she may just need this after four months off
runners.name: Stacey Racey
runners.spotlight: Has dropped 7lb below her last winning mark, but her best form has come over shorter and she may just need this after four months off.

runners.comment: Won a handicap at Southwell six days ago; drops in grade; high on list

runners.name: Hannahs Story

runners.comment: C&D winner; has a bit to find on these terms but the return to this grade could revive him

runners.spotlight: 2-4 at this level including a win over C&D just under a year ago; has regressed since and has a bit to find on these terms, but the return to this grade could revive him.

runners.comment: 0-12 and has enough to prove back from another four months off
runners.name: Spirit Charmer
runners.spotlight: Glimpses of form on a couple of occasions last year, but is 0-12 and has enough to prove back from another four months off.

runners.comment: Third over C&D last month, but that took his record under rules to 0-22; far from solid
runners.name: Tilsworth Max
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye when third of 12 in a 0-55 handicap over C&D last month and the fourth has won twice since, but he was sent off 125-1 for that and it took his record under rules to 0-22; far from solid.

runners.comment: Placed once from nine starts on the AW and losing run up to 17; others more compelling
runners.name: Voodoo Ray
runners.spotlight: Five wins on turf, but placed once from nine starts on the AW and losing run up to 17; others more compelling.

runners.comment: Sole success came over C&D; drops to this level for the first time; worth a second look
runners.name: Zaltalla
runners.spotlight: Sole success in 24 starts came in a 0-52 handicap over C&D in August; didn't run very well in a 0-55 handicap here 19 days ago (behind Tilsworth Max), but drops to this level for the first time; worth a second look.

12:40.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.comment: In good form over the past week with a win and a narrow defeat; clearly in good heart

runners.comment: Beaten upwards of 10l in last four starts; off three months and opposable

runners.owner: Lynn Cullimore Pete Ponting Joe Ponting
runners.spotlight: Close second of nine at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) in August, but beaten upwards of 10l in four starts since and losing run up to 16; off three months and opposable.

runners.comment: 0-16 and recent form has been patchy, but drops to this level for the first time
runners.name: Dr Ali
runners.spotlight: 0-16 and recent form has been patchy, but he could be given a chance on his second of 14 in a 0-55 handicap at Southwell (6f, Tapeta) in October and drops to this level for the first time.

runners.comment: Fourth of 12 over 1m here last month, but is now 0-19; best watched
runners.name: Invincible Storm
runners.spotlight: Ran well to finish fourth of 12 here (1m; 100-1) last month, but that performance the exception rather than the rule and he is now 0-19; best watched.

runners.comment: Fourth of nine over C&D last month but didn't build on it here a week ago; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Miraflores
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden who seemed to improve when fourth of nine over C&D last month, but didn't build on it back here a week ago; needs the cheekpieces to bring about a resurgence.

runners.name: Under Curfew
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is 0-18 since winning a 0-55 handicap at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) last February and is just 2-49 on the AW; better over shorter in any case.

runners.comment: Drops into a 0-50 for the first time, but is now 0-29; doubts remain
runners.name: Valadero
runners.spotlight: Placed 12 times and drops into a 0-50 for the first time, but finished behind Vitalline at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) last month; 6lb better off, but is now 0-29 so doubts remain.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; didn't enjoy a clear run here last time; capable if the gaps appear
runners.name: Vitalline
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner and 1-2 at this level; back to form when winning a 0-55 handicap at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) last month, and he didn't enjoy much luck under his penalty back here five days later; capable if the gaps appear when he needs them.

runners.name: Imperial Decision

runners.name: Genuine Warrior

runners.comment: Big prices and he struggled in two runs here (7f/1m) here last month; passed over
runners.name: Klammer Express
runners.spotlight: Big prices and he struggled in two runs here (7f/1m) last month; has a good pedigree and is still early days but he needs to show a lot more on this step up to 1m2f.

runners.comment: Promising fourth at Chelmsford and sets clear standard on that debut form; strong claims
runners.name: Siam Ruby
runners.spotlight: Australia filly who made some promising late headway when fourth of nine on Chelmsford debut (1m, Polytrack) last month; sets a clear standard on that eyecatching effort and she's open to progress on this step up in trip; strong claims for in-form yard.

runners.comment: Easy win at Wolverhampton but was well held here last time and she's untried at this trip
runners.name: Dark Rosa
runners.spotlight: Shot back up the weights after an easy win at Wolverhampton (8.6f) in November and was only seventh of ten here (1m) last month; still lightly raced on AW but has bit to prove again and she's untried at this trip.

runners.comment: Mercurial type who won at Southwell but was well held at Kempton latest; risks attached
runners.name: Woodstock City
runners.spotlight: 6yo who bounced back with a win at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta) in October but he couldn't make an impact at Kempton last month; remains well treated on old form but he's not easy to predict and comes with risks attached.

runners.comment: Out of sorts in final two runs last year
runners.name: Annexation
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 1m2f on turf in the autumn but he struggled back over hurdles in November and was ninth of ten over C&D last month; has something to prove again and he needs to get back on track.

runners.comment: 0-9 but she's on a reduced mark and could be dangerous back up in trip
runners.name: Flightofthephoenix
runners.owner: Old Gold Racing Tim Cottier & Partner

runners.breeder: S A R L Haras De Saint Julien
runners.comment: Two wins last summer but he's been quiet in both runs this winter; others preferred

runners.spotlight: Started off for Denis Quinn with two turf wins (1m2f/11.6f) in May/June but returned from 158-day break with down-the-field runs last month; now goes back up in trip but he's missed the break in last two starts and others are more solid.

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo but she needs improvement with cheekpieces added
runners.name: Alta Rica
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in her qualifying runs but she couldn't make an impact in two handicaps (1m2f/1m4f) in the autumn; still unexposed but she needs improvement with cheekpieces added after a short break.

runners.comment: Last win was in August 2024 and he's finished down the field in last six runs; opposable
runners.name: King Of Charm
runners.spotlight: Won at Sandown (1m, good) in August 2024 but he's 0-9 since and has finished down the field in his last six runs; mark continues to fall but he has plenty to prove at this new trip.

runners.comment: Didn't fire in final two runs for Roger Teal and has bit to prove on return for new yard
runners.name: Johnjay

runners.comment: Was struggling on the Flat before trailing home last on his hurdling debut in August

runners.comment: Runs well now and again but has finished right out the back over C&D in her last two races

runners.spotlight: Runs well now and again but has finished right out the back over C&D in her last two races; now 0-12.

runners.comment: No wins in seven and inconsistent form at up to 2m; looks risky dropping in trip
runners.name: Woodshaw
runners.spotlight: No wins in seven and inconsistent form at up to 2m; looks risky dropping in trip with cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Running fairly well here off a reasonable mark and returning to 1m2f should benefit
runners.name: Alpine Sierra

runners.comment: Disappoints more often than not these days and this a very belated first try at 1m2f

runners.comment: Twelve wins to his name but an 11yo now and doesn't arrive here in much form at all

runners.comment: Veteran who won a shade cosily over 7f a fortnight ago; 5lb rise is not insurmountable
runners.name: Eligible

runners.name: Tasever

16:20.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.comment: Has won over C&D and might be sharper for her recent run in a handicap here

runners.comment: Beaten about 10l last week at Southwell and others are better treated at these weights
runners.name: Barneys Bay
runners.spotlight: Poor strike-rate and in poor form the last twice on either side of a break; beaten about 10l last week at Southwell and others are better treated at these weights.
