runners.comment: Stuck on a long losing run but has been running pretty well in handicaps here
runners.name: Crownthorpe
runners.owner: Mrs M Doherty & A D Brown
runners.spotlight: Stuck on a long losing run but has been running pretty well in handicaps here and looks highly likely to be involved at this level.

runners.comment: Was a maiden but put that right here yesterday on stable debut; won comfortably
runners.name: Eagles Whistle
runners.spotlight: Was running well on turf in the autumn (in Ireland) and defied unfavourable terms in classified company with a fairly comfortable win here yesterday when making stable debut after a break (also had a wide trip); would need taking very seriously if turned out again, even with the penalty.

runners.comment: Regressed for previous yard and remote finishes with and without blinkers for current one
runners.name: Galileos Compass
runners.spotlight: Regressed for his previous yard and remote finishes with and without blinkers for current one; no obvious significance in the return of a tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Has placed form here and this is her first time in a classified race
runners.name: Miss Raincloud
runners.spotlight: Not the easiest to predict but has placed form here and this is her first time in a classified race; could have some role to play.

runners.comment: Has won a classified race on turf; respectable first run in blinkers but well held since
runners.name: One More Bottle
runners.spotlight: Has won a classified race on turf; beaten 4l when runner-up over C&D in October when blinkered for the first time but hasn't gone on from that.

runners.comment: Stable debut when pushing the right horse close in one of these at Southwell 6 days ago
runners.name: Relevant Range
runners.spotlight: Nothing like the force of old when trained in Ireland, but having first run for this yard when pushing the hot favourite close in a 1m classified race at Southwell six days ago; massive shout with a repeat of that effort.

runners.breeder: A F G & Mrs S L Brimble
runners.comment: 2l to find with Relevant Range on their Southwell clash but she ran well; course winner
runners.name: Wheres The Crumpet
runners.spotlight: Has 2l to find with Relevant Range on their Southwell clash but she ran well and has winning form here; each-way claims.

runners.comment: Could be interesting if there's some confidence behind him but best watched otherwise
runners.name: Yorkstone
runners.spotlight: Previously better than this level but was struggling to get competitive (including here) when last seen ten months ago; could be interesting if there's some confidence behind him but best watched otherwise.

16:50.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.comment: 0-23; first run in this grade, has a good course record and is no forlorn hope
runners.name: Al Baahy
runners.spotlight: Yet to win in 23 attempts on the AW; having first run in this grade but having run creditably on two of his four starts here, is no forlorn hope.

runners.comment: Two wins last year, second over 9.5f at Wolverhampton; below-par when last out; a possible
runners.name: Anificas Beauty
runners.spotlight: Won at Pontefract (1m, good) and Wolverhampton (9.5f) last year but form tailed off later on; back after a break and down in grade, so not out of it.

runners.comment: Poor form in three races last spring (first on AW); down in grade and worth a market check
runners.name: Aye Up Tom
runners.spotlight: Poor efforts in an AW maiden and two turf novices last spring; down in grade and worth a market check on first run in this grade.

runners.comment: 3,000gns buy after AW win last January; poor efforts here on last three runs; bit to prove
runners.name: Freak Encounter
runners.spotlight: Ex-Jamie Osborne; sold for 3,000gns after Lingfield win last January (1m); has shown bits of fair form for present yard, but ended the year with three low-key runs here; bit to prove now.

runners.comment: Poor form so far, including on handicap debut here; unexposed but plenty to prove
runners.name: Lady Sonata
runners.spotlight: Poor form in maiden/novices (7f/1m) and on handicap debut over 6f here; unexposed and tongue-tie now tried but plenty to prove.

runners.comment: 1-24 overall (0-7 on AW); two fair runs in the summer but below form last few runs
runners.name: Madame Plaintiff
runners.owner: The Jocks And The Geordies II
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-24 (0-7 on the AW); two fair runs last summer, including on the AW but rather out of form in the autumn with this combination of headgear tried last time; needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Ex-Irish; 0-8 on AW; two fair runs since joining Ian Williams and not without a chance
runners.name: Pink Socks
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; 0-29 (0-8 on AW); has run two fair races since joining Ian Williams and is closely-matched with Al Baahy (3lb better off for a length) when the pair were third and fourth at Wolverhampton in December (8.5f); quite interesting.

runners.comment: Seven-time C&D winner; good 2nd here in October; not so good since but worth considering
runners.name: Pop Favorite
runners.spotlight: Goes well here as seven of his eight wins have been over C&D; good second here in October, and although below-par on both runs since 71-day break, is well worth considering in an ordinary race.

runners.comment: 0-14; in good form in May, but not as good since; stable going well; each-way chance
runners.name: That Lucas Fella
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden; has shown fair form on occasions, notably when runner-up at Carlisle and Wolverhampton in May; various headgear tried, including today's blinkers; needs to improve on his last couple of runs but has an each-way chance in this ordinary race.

runners.comment: 0-17 on the AW; ran well over C&D on a couple of occasions last winter but is unreliable
runners.name: Top Gun Tina
runners.spotlight: 0-17 on the AW; ran well over C&D on a couple of occasions last winter but is far from reliable.

17:20.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Novice Stakes

runners.comment: Easily landing the odds in C&D maiden latest; the one to beat under a 7lb penalty
runners.name: Inspired
runners.spotlight: Twice-raced Dubawi colt who built on debut second after 11 months off when easily landing the odds in maiden over C&D 25 days ago; he looks to have a fair bit more to offer and is the one to beat despite conceding weight all round.

runners.comment: Failed to build on debut when fifth in 6f maiden here in November; plenty more is required
runners.name: Al Muddy
runners.spotlight: Failed to build on his debut fifth when occupying the same position in 6f maiden here in November; plenty more is required.

runners.breeder: Forenaghts Stud Farm Ltd & Sam Mencoff
runners.comment: Son of Starspangledbanner who is in good hands and needs considering on his debut
runners.name: Multaneighttothree
runners.spotlight: 75,000euros foal, 65,000gns yearling; half-brother to three winners, including Roxy Art (6f AW; RPR 88) and Media Mogul (1m4f/1m6f AW; RPR 82); dam, placed over 7f/1m (Group 3; RPR 104), is a half-sister to 1m Listed winner Army Of Angels; this Starspangledbanner gelding is in good hands and needs considering on his debut, especially if the market vibes are positive.

runners.comment: Beat only one for new yard after 16 months off in C&D maiden latest; lots more required
runners.name: Rajstar
runners.spotlight: Son of Blue Point who showed some promise when a debut sixth in 7f Curragh maiden for Dermot Weld, but beat only one home for his new yard after 16 months off in C&D maiden 25 days ago; needs to take a major step forward.

runners.comment: Shaped well when a clear second at Lingfield; a likely player with better to come
runners.name: Ted Le Saux
runners.spotlight: 9-2, shaped well when a clear second of seven in 1m2f Lingfield novice on his debut 39 days ago; this well-related son of Cracksman is a likely player with better to come.

runners.comment: Fading fifth over 1m here 32 days ago; not ruled out back at 7f off a 2lb lower mark
runners.name: Storm The Dug
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced 4yo who failed to build on reappearance fourth here when a fading fifth of eight in 1m handicap here 32 days ago; this return to 7f could suit so he's not ruled out off a 2lb lower mark.

runners.comment: C&D scorer but he came in last of eight over C&D for his new yard four weeks ago
runners.name: Beelzebub
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer but he came in last of eight over C&D for his new yard four weeks ago; it's now 15 starts since his last success.

runners.comment: Thriving for new yard after pair of 6f wins here; up 6lb but merits serious consideration
runners.name: Goldmoyne
runners.spotlight: A fair ex-Irish 7f scorer; thriving under the expert tutelage of James Owen and bids for a hat-trick after recent 6f handicap wins here; up another 6lb but he merits serious consideration back up to 7f.

runners.comment: Good fourth over 1m here nine days ago; this three-time C&D winner can go well again
runners.name: Concert Boy
runners.owner: Making Headway Racing And K Scott
runners.spotlight: Signed off 2025 with an impressive course win and backed it up with a good fourth of nine in another 1m handicap here nine days ago; this three-time C&D winner can go well again.

runners.comment: Won over C&D and backed it up with a solid C&D third 25 days ago; one to consider
runners.name: Front Gunner
runners.spotlight: Ex-Ann Duffield; gained a second C&D success in November and backed it up with a solid third of 12 over C&D 25 days ago; needs considering off the same mark; first outing under the care of Stephen Hanlon.

runners.comment: Winless since 2023 and he's not proving the easiest to catch right of late
runners.name: Angel Of England
runners.owner: The Jocks And The Geordies II
runners.spotlight: Winless since 2023 and he's not proving the easiest to catch right of late, only ninth of 12 in 6f Southwell handicap 23 days ago; needs this switch of headgear to spark improvement.

runners.comment: A six-time course scorer but he comes here under a cloud; others appeal more
runners.name: Bonito Cavalo
runners.spotlight: A six-time course scorer but he comes here under a cloud, last of ten in 5f handicap here four weeks ago; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Took a step forward when third at Redcar in August; possibilities on her h'cap debut
runners.name: Siviez
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced daughter of Ardad who took a step forward when third of five in 1m Redcar maiden in August; returns for her handicap debut now and possibilities.

runners.comment: Bagged a fifth course victory over 1m here nine days ago; can make his presence felt
runners.name: Trais Fluors
runners.spotlight: Bagged a fifth course victory over 1m here nine days ago despite conceding first run to the second; this C&D scorer can make his presence felt despite a 3lb weights rise.

runners.comment: Too free when below-par at Wolverhampton in October; reverts in trip and no forlorn hope
runners.name: Lord Capulet
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who raced too freely when a below-par seventh in 8.6f Wolverhampton handicap in October; reverts in trip after a break and he's no forlorn hope in his bid to gain a maiden success.

runners.comment: Step forward for new stable when sixth over C&D latest; lightly-raced and may do better
runners.name: Carida
runners.spotlight: Off seven months but she took a step forward for her new yard on her handicap debut when sixth of 13 to Ridgemaster over C&D 22 days ago; this lightly-raced filly may do better still.

runners.comment: Much improved on yard debut with C&D win 22 days ago; up 4lb but he's not taken lightly
runners.name: Ridgemaster
runners.spotlight: Much improved on his stable debut (formerly with Hugo Palmer) when getting off the mark over C&D 22 days ago; up 4lb but he's not taken lightly in his current mood.

18:20.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap

runners.comment: Below par last two starts for George Scott but not discounted on yard/handicap debut here
runners.name: King Of Chaos
runners.spotlight: Showcasing gelding who shaped well on his debut when third in 6f Windsor maiden in May, but raced too freely when twice below that form subsequently at Salisbury and York for George Scott; starts out for a new yard here after a beak and can't be discounted on his handicap debut.

runners.comment: Good start for new yard with 6f maiden third here 22 days ago; considered going h'capping
runners.name: Justmyluck
runners.spotlight: A fair maiden for John Butler who made a good start for his new stable after three months off when third of 13 in 6f maiden here 22 days ago; one to consider now going into handicaps.

runners.comment: Progressive sort who landed Southwell novice latest; big player now going into handicaps
runners.name: Sound And Vision
runners.spotlight: Progressive Starman filly who got off the mark in 5f Southwell novice 22 days ago; she looks to have more to offer for her handicap debut; big player.

runners.comment: Only fifth over C&D latest; could bounce back now handicapping with a visor added
runners.name: See That Spark
runners.spotlight: Enters calculations on the form of his 6f third here in November, but he came in only fifth of seven over C&D following month; no surprise to see him bounce back now handicapping with a visor added.

runners.comment: Good second at Beverley in September; improving and must enter calculations now h'capping
runners.name: Mereside Spark
runners.spotlight: Stayed on late when a good second of nine in 5f Beverley novice in September; this improving daughter of Far Above must enter calculations on her first venture into handicap company.

runners.comment: Bagged a third win of 2025 in Lingfield nursery latest; up 5lb but she's not taken lightly
runners.name: Mad Unicorn
runners.spotlight: On the up since joining Michael Keady and she bagged a third win of 2025 in 6f Lingfield nursery 26 days ago; up 5lb but she's not taken lightly in her current mood.

18:50.race_name: Midnite Ain't Your Grandad's Bookie Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: 4lb higher than when off the mark over C&D last time; seems to be going the right way
runners.name: Penny Mountain
runners.spotlight: Picked up well to make it 11th-time lucky over C&D nine days ago; 4lb higher but she seems to be going the right way now; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Losing run up to 23; ran better last time but may again find one or two too good
runners.name: Court Of Session
runners.spotlight: Losing run up to 23, but he ran better dropped in grade and trip when second of nine at Southwell (6f, Tapeta) six days ago; races off the same mark, but may again find one or two too good.

runners.comment: C&D winner, but has been shaping as though in need of a return to 7f
runners.name: Flash The Dash
runners.spotlight: C&D winner, but his other two wins have come over 7f and last two efforts suggest a return to that trip may be in order; cheekpieces return.

runners.comment: Record over C&D since October reads 322113; another big run seems likely
runners.name: Yorkshire Glory
runners.spotlight: Handy sort whose record over C&D since October reads 322113; races off the same mark as when third of nine 12 days ago and another big run seems likely.

runners.comment: 4lb higher than when making all over C&D nine days ago; dangerous if leading again
runners.name: Spartan Fighter
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.spotlight: Often makes the running which he did when ending a 22-race losing run over C&D nine days ago (time was faster than Penny Mountain in the other division); 4lb higher, but possible he could again enjoy the run of the race and would be dangerous if does.

runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mrs B E Moore
runners.comment: Finished well behind Yorkshire Glory over C&D last month; needs a resurgence
runners.name: Pinpoint
runners.spotlight: Back off the same mark as when winning at Hamilton (5f, good; first-time visor) last summer, but finished well behind Yorkshire Glory over C&D (first-time tongue-tie) last month; needs a resurgence.

runners.comment: Six wins over C&D, but needs to bounce back from a lesser effort nine days ago
runners.name: Fircombe Hall
runners.spotlight: Six wins over C&D and only beaten a neck by Yorkshire Glory here last month, but not so good behind Penny Mountain nine days ago; needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: 1-31 and finished 5l behind Spartan Fighter over C&D nine days ago; others stronger
runners.name: Shesashambles
runners.spotlight: 1-31 and finished 5l behind Spartan Fighter over C&D nine days ago; others stronger.

19:20.race_name: Midnite Ain't Your Grandad's Bookie Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: In good form, a close C&D eighth latest; this five-time C&D winner can't be ruled out
runners.name: Asadjumeirah
runners.spotlight: Gained a fifth C&D success in September and has continued in good form, a close eighth of 12 back over C&D three weeks ago; not ruled out off a 2lb lower mark here.

runners.comment: Comes here in very good nick; a likely player nudged up 1lb in his bid for a maiden win
runners.name: Instant Bond
runners.owner: David Tate Danny Lawson & Kevin Broadley
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 5yo who comes here in very good nick, runner-up in 7f handicap here 12 days ago despite going freely; a likely player nudged up 1lb in his bid for a breakthrough success.

runners.comment: Course winner; back on track with Southwell third six days ago; can make his presence felt
runners.name: Ramon Di Loria
runners.spotlight: Course winner who got back on track when third of nine in 6f Southwell handicap six days ago; can make his presence felt again off an unchanged mark.

runners.comment: Had wind op before ninth over C&D handicap 25 days ago; she's not easy to make a case for
runners.name: Bella Love
runners.spotlight: Is 0-17 and she underwent breathing surgery before coming in ninth of 14 in C&D handicap 25 days ago; she's not easy to make a case for.

runners.comment: Good third of 14 over C&D 25 days ago; this C&D winner ought to be thereabouts once more
runners.name: Superior Council
runners.spotlight: Resumed winning ways over C&D in November and he posted a good third of 14 back over C&D 25 days ago; ought to be thereabouts once more.

runners.comment: Course specialist but not proving easy to catch right of late; still can't be discounted
runners.name: Athollblair Boy
runners.spotlight: Course specialist but he's not proving easy to catch right of late, just seventh of 12 over C&D nine days ago; this veteran still can't be discounted though.

runners.comment: Improved when a C&D third 11 months ago; off since though so has her fitness to prove
runners.name: Queen For Adaay
runners.spotlight: Yet to get her head in front but she advanced her form when a close third of ten in C&D handicap 11 months ago; off since though so has her fitness to prove.

runners.comment: Last of nine in 6f classified event at Wolverhampton four days ago; others appeal more
runners.name: Poet
runners.spotlight: It's now 12 starts since her C&D success and she was tried in blinkers when last of nine in 6f classified event at Wolverhampton four days ago; others appeal more.
